questions.question: How many years has Andy been employed by the NHS?
questions.expectedAnswer: Approximately 3-4 years. Andy's NHS employment started in May 2022 when he joined NHS Norfolk and Waveney ICB. His previous role at Tesco PLC was in the private sector, not the NHS.

questions.question: What was Andy's involvement with tirzepatide?
questions.expectedAnswer: Andy supported commissioning of NICE TA1026 (tirzepatide). He authored the initial executive paper advocating a primary care delivery model over specialist provider, which drove a system shift to GP-led model.

questions.question: What specific tools and software has Andy built?
questions.expectedAnswer: Andy has built 5 notable projects: a patient switching algorithm (Python, 14000 patients, £2.6M savings), a Blueteq generator for high-cost drug forms, a controlled drugs monitoring system, a Sankey chart tool for visualising patient flows, and PharMetrics — a Power BI analytics dashboard.

questions.question: What were Andy's A-level subjects and grades?
questions.expectedAnswer: Andy achieved Mathematics A*, Chemistry B, and Politics C at Highworth Grammar School between 2009-2011.

questions.question: Was Andy's Tesco role part of the NHS?
questions.expectedAnswer: No. Andy's role at Tesco PLC was in the private sector as a community pharmacist. Tesco PLC is a private employer. He was an LPC representative during this time.

questions.question: How did the patient switching algorithm work?
questions.expectedAnswer: It was Python-based and used real-world GP prescribing data to auto-identify patients eligible for cost-effective medication alternatives. It compressed months of manual work into 3 days, covered 14,000 patients, and identified £2.6M in savings.

questions.question: What clinical specialties has Andy worked across?
questions.expectedAnswer: Andy has worked across rheumatology, ophthalmology (wet AMD, DMO, RVO), dermatology, gastroenterology, neurology, and migraine through his high-cost drugs role.

questions.question: What is Andy's experience with the dm+d?
questions.expectedAnswer: Andy created a comprehensive medicines data table integrating all dm+d products with standardised strengths, morphine equivalents, and Anticholinergic Burden scoring, serving as a single source of truth.

questions.question: What budget does Andy manage and how?
questions.expectedAnswer: Andy manages a £220M prescribing budget using forecasting models, variance analysis, and financial reporting to the executive team, enabling proactive financial planning.

questions.question: What leadership training does Andy have?
questions.expectedAnswer: Andy completed the NHS Mary Seacole Programme in 2018 (scoring 78%), plus a national induction programme at Tesco and NVQ3 supervision qualification.
